faq.q1: How do I start a transaction?
faq.a1: Very easy! Deposit balance first, then fill out the order form. Choose the currency to buy/sell (Crypto, PayPal, or Skrill). Transactions processed in 5-15 minutes. Starting from Rp 25,000. Read the getting started guide for complete steps.
faq.q2: What are the min and max transaction amounts?
faq.a2: Minimum transaction is Rp 25,000 for all services. For maximum, contact customer service for details.
faq.a3: Transactions are processed in 5-15 minutes after order confirmation. Large amounts may need extra time for verification.
faq.a4: Absolutely! Saldopedia uses SSL 256-bit encryption, automatic verification, and 100% data protection. We've served thousands of transactions with high satisfaction.
faq.a5: Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), USDT, BNB, Solana, MATIC, and other popular cryptocurrencies. See the full cryptocurrency list available.
faq.q6: How do I pay for orders?
faq.a6: All orders are paid using Saldopedia balance. Top up your balance first via the Deposit menu, then use it to place orders. Sales proceeds also go to your balance and can be withdrawn anytime.
faq.q7: Can I trade PayPal and Skrill?
faq.a7: Yes! Besides crypto, we also offer PayPal and Skrill buy & sell services with competitive rates. Fast processing for small or large amounts.
faq.q8: How do I check the latest rates?
faq.a8: Rates are always updated following real-time market prices. Check the Rates page or use the Calculator on website.
faq.a9: No hidden fees! The displayed rate is final. What you see is what you pay.
faq.q10: How do I contact customer service?
faq.a10: Contact WhatsApp 08119666620. Our team is ready to help with fast and friendly response!
faq.q11: Do I need to register an account?
faq.a11: Yes, you need to register an account to transact. Registration is easy and fast - just fill in your details, verify your email, and your account is ready. Read the registration guide for complete steps.
faq.q12: What if my transfer is confirmed late?
faq.a12: Payments are detected automatically. If issues persist after 30 minutes, contact WhatsApp with transfer proof.
faq.q13: Can I transact outside business hours?
faq.a13: Yes! Orders can be sent 24/7. Customer service is active 09:00-21:00 WIB, but orders are still processed automatically anytime.
faq.q14: How do I cancel a transaction?
faq.a14: Before paying, just ignore the order. If already paid, contact WhatsApp 08119666620 immediately.
faq.a15: Data security is our priority. All information is kept confidential with encryption for maximum protection. Learn more in our security guide.

whoWeAre.title: Who We Are
whoWeAre.paragraph1: Saldopedia is an Indonesian fintech platform for buying and selling cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill. Founded in 2020, we make digital asset transactions fast and secure.
whoWeAre.paragraph2: Born from Indonesia's need for accessible digital asset services, we built Saldopedia with one goal: to provide a simple, transparent, and trusted transaction experience for everyone.
whoWeAre.paragraph3: Our team consists of experienced professionals in cryptocurrency, fintech, and customer service. We understand that every transaction is a trust that must be honored, which is why we always prioritize user security and comfort.
whoWeAre.paragraph4: With a minimum transaction of Rp 25,000, we open access to digital investment for anyone - from beginners just learning about crypto to experienced traders who need fast and reliable service.
whoWeAre.paragraph5: Transactions are processed in 5-15 minutes with multi-layer security and responsive customer service. We are committed to being your trusted partner in the digital asset world.

commitment.title: Our Transparency Commitment
commitment.content: Saldopedia is committed to being transparent about the technologies we use on our website. This Cookie Policy comprehensively explains how we use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience, secure our services, and understand how our website is used. We believe you have the right to know what data is collected and to have control over your privacy preferences.

section1.title: 1. Introduction and Scope
section1.p1: This Cookie Policy is an integral part of Saldopedia's Privacy Policy and explains in detail the cookies and similar tracking technologies used on our website. This policy applies to all visitors and users of the Saldopedia website, including public pages, user dashboard, and all subdomains operated by Saldopedia.
section1.p2: By continuing to use our website after reading this Cookie Policy, you acknowledge understanding and consent to the use of cookies as described in this document. If you do not consent to the use of certain cookies, you have the option to control and disable those cookies through your browser settings or cookie preferences on our website.
section1.p3: We periodically update this Cookie Policy to reflect changes in technology, our practices, or legal requirements. We recommend that you review this policy regularly to stay informed about how we use cookies.

section2.title: 2. What Are Cookies and Similar Technologies?

sub1.title: 2.1 Cookie Definition
sub1.content: Cookies are small text files containing data that are stored on your device (computer, smartphone, tablet, or other device) when you visit a website. Cookies are sent by the web server to your browser and stored on your device. When you visit the same website again, the browser sends the cookie back to the server, allowing the website to recognize your device and remember information about previous visits such as language preferences, login status, and other settings.

sub2.title: 2.2 Types of Cookies by Source
sub2.firstPartyDesc: Cookies set directly by the website domain you are visiting (saldopedia.com). These cookies are managed by Saldopedia and used for core website functions, user experience, and security.
sub2.thirdPartyDesc: Cookies set by domains other than the website you are visiting. These cookies are placed by third-party services integrated with our website, such as analytics services (Google Analytics), social media widgets, or advertising services.

sub3.title: 2.3 Similar Tracking Technologies
sub3.intro: In addition to cookies, we may use other similar tracking technologies:
sub3.localStorage: Local Storage and Session Storage: Browser storage mechanisms that allow websites to store data on your device, similar to cookies but with larger storage capacity and different characteristics.
sub3.pixel: Web Beacons and Pixel Tags: Small transparent images embedded in web pages or emails that allow us to track whether pages have been viewed or emails have been opened.
sub3.fingerprint: Device Fingerprinting: A technique that collects information about your device configuration for security and fraud prevention purposes.
sub3.sdk: SDKs and APIs: Software Development Kits and Application Programming Interfaces used to integrate third-party services into our website.

section3.title: 3. Purposes of Cookie Use at Saldopedia
section3.intro: Saldopedia uses cookies and similar technologies for various legitimate and beneficial purposes for our users. The following is a complete explanation of why we use cookies:

sub1.title: 3.1 Essential Website Operations
sub1.content: Essential cookies enable basic website functions such as page navigation, access to secure areas, and transaction processing. Without these cookies, the website cannot function properly. Essential cookies also help secure the website from harmful activities, protect user data, and ensure the integrity of your login session. Essential cookies cannot be disabled as they are required for basic website operation.

sub2.title: 3.2 Personalization and User Preferences
sub2.content: Preference cookies allow the website to remember choices you make and provide a more personalized experience. This includes remembering your language choice (Indonesian or English), display theme preference (light or dark mode), regional settings, and other preferences you set. With preference cookies, you don't need to reset your choices every time you visit the website, making your browsing experience more convenient and efficient.

sub3.title: 3.3 Analysis and Performance Improvement
sub3.content: Analytics cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website. These cookies collect anonymous or aggregate information about pages visited, visit duration, navigation paths, traffic sources, and other performance metrics. This information is invaluable for identifying popular pages, areas needing improvement, technical issues, and opportunities to enhance the overall user experience. Analytics data helps us make data-driven decisions for website development.

sub4.title: 3.4 Security and Fraud Prevention
sub4.content: Security cookies help us protect users and the platform from harmful activities. These cookies help detect and prevent cyber attacks, identify suspicious login activities, verify that requests come from legitimate browsers (not bots), protect forms from CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) attacks, and support secure authentication systems. Security is our top priority, and cookies play an important role in protecting your account and data.

sub5.title: 3.5 Marketing and Communication (Optional)
sub5.content: Marketing cookies, if enabled, are used to track visitors across websites and build interest profiles to display more relevant ads. These cookies also help measure the effectiveness of our marketing campaigns and understand user conversion paths. Marketing cookies are entirely optional and require explicit consent from you. You can decline marketing cookies without affecting core website functionality.

section4.title: 4. Categories of Cookies We Use
section4.intro: The following is a detailed explanation of each category of cookies used on the Saldopedia website:

necessary.title: 4.1 Strictly Necessary Cookies
necessary.description: Strictly necessary cookies are essential cookies that enable basic website functions and cannot be disabled in our system. These cookies are usually only set in response to actions you take that constitute a service request, such as setting privacy preferences, logging into an account, or filling out forms. The website cannot function properly without these cookies.

examples.session: Login Session Cookies: Keep you logged in while navigating between pages and ensure the security of your session. These cookies are deleted when you log out or close your browser.
examples.consent: Consent Cookies: Store your cookie consent choices so we don't display the cookie banner repeatedly.
examples.security: Security Cookies: Protect the website from cyber attacks, validate requests, and ensure transaction integrity.
examples.csrf: CSRF Tokens: Protect forms from Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks.
examples.load: Load Balancing Cookies: Ensure optimal traffic distribution to our servers.

necessary.retention: Duration: Session (deleted when browser closes) to 24 hours
necessary.consentAnswer: No (these cookies are essential and cannot be disabled)

preference.title: 4.2 Preference/Functionality Cookies
preference.description: Preference cookies allow the website to remember information that changes how the website behaves or looks. These cookies help provide a more personalized and convenient experience by remembering your choices. If you disable preference cookies, some settings may not be saved and you may need to set them again each visit.

examples.language: Language Preference: Stores your language choice (Indonesian or English) so the website displays in your chosen language.
examples.theme: Theme Preference: Remembers your display mode choice (light or dark) based on your preference or automatically adjusts based on local time.
examples.regional: Regional Settings: Stores date format, currency, and other regional setting preferences.
examples.accessibility: Accessibility Settings: Stores accessibility preferences if available.

analytics.title: 4.3 Analytics and Statistics Cookies
analytics.description: Analytics cookies help us understand how visitors interact with the website by collecting and reporting information anonymously or pseudonymously. These cookies allow us to analyze website traffic, identify the most popular pages, understand user navigation paths, and detect technical issues. Collected data is used to improve overall performance and user experience.

examples.visitors: Visitor Statistics: Track unique visitor counts, pageviews, session duration, and other engagement metrics.
examples.source: Traffic Sources: Identify where visitors come from (search engines, social media, referrals, or direct visits).
examples.behavior: User Behavior: Understand how users navigate the website, which pages are visited, and which features are used.
examples.performance: Website Performance: Measure page loading times, error rates, and other technical metrics.
examples.googleAnalytics: Google Analytics: A web analytics service from Google that provides insights about traffic and visitor behavior (if enabled).

analytics.retention: Duration: 1 to 24 months depending on analytics service

marketing.title: 4.4 Marketing and Advertising Cookies
marketing.description: Marketing cookies are used to track visitors across websites with the aim of displaying relevant and interesting ads to individual users. These cookies also help measure the effectiveness of ad campaigns and limit the frequency of the same ad being displayed. Marketing cookies are typically placed by advertising networks with the website operator's permission.
marketing.examplesTitle: Marketing cookies that may be used:

examples.relevantAds: Ad Targeting: Build interest profiles based on browsing behavior to display more relevant ads.
examples.retargeting: Retargeting: Display ads to visitors who have previously visited our website while they browse other websites.
examples.conversion: Conversion Tracking: Measure campaign effectiveness by tracking actions taken after viewing an ad.
examples.social: Social Media Widgets: Cookies from social media platforms that enable content sharing and display social content.
examples.thirdParty: Facebook Pixel and Google Ads: Third-party advertising services for targeting and measurement (if enabled).

section5.title: 5. Third-Party Cookies and Integrated Services
section5.intro: In addition to cookies we set directly (first-party cookies), our website may include cookies from integrated third-party services. We work with trusted service providers, but it is important to understand that we do not have full control over the cookies they set.

sub1.title: 5.1 Analytics Services
sub1.content: We may use third-party analytics services such as Google Analytics to collect and analyze data about website usage. These services set their own cookies to identify unique visitors, track sessions, and collect behavioral data. Collected data is generally anonymous or pseudonymous and used for statistical purposes and website improvement.

sub2.title: 5.2 Social Media Widgets
sub2.content: Our website may include widgets or share buttons from social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram. These widgets allow you to share content and interact with social platforms. When you interact with these widgets, social media platforms may set cookies for their own purposes, including ad targeting.

sub3.title: 5.3 Payment and Security Services
sub3.content: To process cryptocurrency transactions and protect the platform from fraud, we integrate third-party payment and security services. These services may use cookies or similar technologies for verification, fraud prevention, and secure transaction processing.

sub4.title: 5.4 Links to Third-Party Privacy Policies
sub4.intro: For more information about the privacy practices and cookies of third-party service providers, please visit their privacy policies:

section6.title: 6. How to Control and Manage Cookies
section6.intro: You have full control over cookies accepted by your device. There are several ways to manage cookie preferences:

sub1.title: 6.1 Cookie Settings on Our Website
sub1.content: When you first visit the Saldopedia website, you will see a banner or popup informing you about cookie usage and requesting your consent. This banner allows you to accept all cookies, reject non-essential cookies, or customize your preferences by category. You can change your cookie preferences at any time by accessing cookie settings through a link in the website footer or cookie settings icon if available.

sub2.title: 6.2 Browser Settings
sub2.intro: Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through browser settings. You can set your browser to reject all cookies, accept all cookies, notify you when cookies are set, or delete existing cookies. How to access cookie settings differs for each browser:
sub2.chrome: Google Chrome: Open Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies and other site data. Here you can block third-party cookies, clear cookies on exit, or manage exceptions for specific sites.
sub2.firefox: Mozilla Firefox: Open Settings > Privacy & Security. In the Cookies and Site Data section, you can choose protection levels and manage cookies in detail.
sub2.safari: Apple Safari: Open Preferences > Privacy. You can block all cookies, prevent cross-site tracking, and manage website data.
sub2.edge: Microsoft Edge: Open Settings > Cookies and site permissions > Cookies and stored data. You can block third-party cookies and manage cookie preferences.

sub3.title: 6.3 Third-Party Opt-Out Tools
sub3.content: Some advertising and analytics services provide direct opt-out mechanisms. For example, Google provides a browser plugin to disable Google Analytics tracking, and the Digital Advertising Alliance provides tools to opt-out of targeted advertising from their members. You can use these tools to manage your privacy preferences across various websites.

sub4.title: 6.4 Impact of Disabling Cookies
sub4.content: It is important to understand that disabling certain cookies may affect website functionality. If you disable essential cookies, the website may not function properly and some features may not be available. Disabling preference cookies means your settings will not be saved between visits. Disabling analytics cookies will not affect your experience, but will limit our ability to improve the website. Disabling marketing cookies means you may still see ads, but they will not be personalized based on your interests.

section7.title: 7. Cookie Storage Duration
section7.intro: Cookies have different storage periods depending on their type and purpose:

sub1.title: 7.1 Session Cookies
sub1.content: Session cookies are temporary cookies that only exist during your browsing session. These cookies are stored in browser memory and are automatically deleted when you close your browser or the session ends. Session cookies are used for functions such as keeping you logged in while navigating between pages and temporarily storing items in a shopping cart.

sub2.title: 7.2 Persistent Cookies
sub2.content: Persistent cookies are cookies that remain stored on your device after the browser is closed and persist for a specified period of time or until you manually delete them. The duration of persistent cookies varies depending on their purpose. Preference cookies may last 6-12 months, analytics cookies may last 1-24 months, and advertising cookies may last several months up to 2 years.

section8.title: 8. Cookie Policy Updates
section8.p1: Saldopedia may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in the technology we use, our privacy practices, applicable legal requirements, or to improve transparency. Any changes to this policy will take effect from the date indicated in the "Last updated" section above.
section8.p2: For significant or material changes, we will endeavor to provide more prominent notice, such as displaying a banner on the website, sending email notification to registered users, or requesting re-consent through a cookie popup. We recommend that you review this Cookie Policy periodically to stay informed about how we use cookies.
section8.p3: Continued use of our website after changes take effect indicates your acceptance of the updated Cookie Policy. If you do not agree with the changes, you can use the cookie control options described above to manage your preferences or stop using our website.

section9.title: 9. Your Rights Regarding Cookies and Privacy
section9.p1: As a Saldopedia website user, you have certain rights regarding data collected through cookies. In accordance with Indonesia's Personal Data Protection Law and international privacy principles, you have the right to know what cookies are used and for what purposes, to accept or reject non-essential cookies, to change your cookie preferences at any time, to request information about data collected through cookies, and to request deletion of cookie-related data (with certain limitations).
section9.p2: To exercise these rights, you can manage cookie preferences through settings on our website, adjust preferences in your browser, or contact our support team for more specific requests. We are committed to responding to your requests within a reasonable time.

section10.title: 10. Contact Us
section10.intro: If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Cookie Policy or our privacy practices, please feel free to contact us through the following official channels:
section10.hours: Customer Service Operating Hours: 09:00 - 21:00 WIB every day
section10.response: We are committed to responding to your inquiries within 1-3 business days.

cookiePolicy.footer: By continuing to use the Saldopedia website after reading this Cookie Policy, you acknowledge understanding and consent to the use of cookies and similar technologies as described in this document. Thank you for trusting Saldopedia for your cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill transaction needs.
