section1.title: 1. Introduction and Scope
section1.p1: Welcome to Saldopedia, an Indonesian fintech platform providing cryptocurrency, PayPal balance, and Skrill balance trading services. This Terms and Conditions document constitutes a legally binding agreement between you as a user and Saldopedia as a service provider. By accessing or using our platform through the website, application, or other official communication channels, you confirm your full consent to all terms contained in this document.
section1.p2: Saldopedia operates as a digital asset exchange platform that facilitates transactions between users and our services. This platform is designed to provide easy access to cryptocurrency and international digital payment services such as PayPal and Skrill with fast, secure, and transparent processing. Our services use an internal balance system that allows users to deposit, place orders, receive sales proceeds, and withdraw funds more efficiently.
section1.p3: These Terms and Conditions apply to all services provided by Saldopedia, including but not limited to: buying and selling cryptocurrency, PayPal and Skrill balance transactions, deposit and withdrawal systems, referral and points programs, and all features available in the user dashboard. We recommend that you read this document thoroughly and keep it for future reference.

section2.title: 2. Definitions and Interpretation
section2.intro: In these Terms and Conditions, the following terms have the following meanings unless the context otherwise requires:
section2.weDesc: refers to Saldopedia as a cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill trading service platform, including all services, features, and facilities operated under the Saldopedia brand.
section2.userDesc: refers to any individual or entity that accesses, registers, or uses Saldopedia services, whether as a registered user or platform visitor.
section2.serviceDesc: refers to all products, features, and facilities provided by Saldopedia including cryptocurrency trading, PayPal and Skrill transactions, deposit and withdrawal systems, user dashboard, and other supporting services.
section2.cryptoDesc: refers to cryptocurrencies and digital assets including but not limited to Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Tether (USDT), Binance Coin (BNB), Solana (SOL), Polygon (MATIC), and other cryptocurrencies supported by the platform.
section2.botDesc: refers to the user's internal balance on the Saldopedia platform that can be used to place orders, receive sales proceeds, and be withdrawn to a bank account. Balance is in Indonesian Rupiah (IDR).
section2.balanceDesc: refers to the process of adding balance by transferring funds from the user's bank account to their Saldopedia account.
section2.withdrawalDesc: refers to the process of withdrawing balance from the Saldopedia account to the user's bank account.
section2.orderDesc: refers to buy or sell instructions created by users through the Saldopedia platform.

sub1.title: 3.1 Eligibility Criteria
sub1.intro: To legally and validly use Saldopedia services, you must meet all of the following criteria without exception:
sub1.age: Be at least 18 (eighteen) years old or have reached legal adult age according to the laws applicable in your jurisdiction. If you have not reached adulthood, you must obtain consent from a parent or legal guardian
sub1.info: Be willing to provide accurate, complete, current, and verifiable information when registering an account and conducting transactions. False or misleading information may result in service denial or account closure
sub1.legal: Not use Saldopedia services for activities that violate the law, including but not limited to money laundering, terrorism financing, fraud, or other criminal activities
sub1.payment: Have a valid Indonesian bank account registered in your own name, or other legitimate payment methods that can be verified by Saldopedia
sub1.telegram: Have an active email address accessible for account verification, transaction notifications, and other important communications. WhatsApp access is also required for certain transaction confirmations

sub2.title: 3.2 Account Registration and Verification
sub2.content: To access full Saldopedia services, you are required to create an account through the registration process on our website. Registration can be done using an email address or through social login options such as Google OAuth. After successful registration, you will have access to the user dashboard that allows you to view your balance, transaction history, make deposits and withdrawals, and access other features. Saldopedia reserves the right to request additional identity verification (Know Your Customer/KYC) for certain transactions or when required to meet regulatory obligations. By registering, you agree to maintain the confidentiality of your account credentials and are fully responsible for all activities that occur on your account.

sub3.title: 3.3 Account Security and Protection
sub3.intro: Your account security is a shared responsibility between Saldopedia and you as a user. You are fully responsible for maintaining account security by:
sub3.secure: Creating and using a strong, unique, and hard-to-guess password. A good password consists of at least 8 characters with a combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols
sub3.confidential: Maintaining the confidentiality of login information including email and password, and not sharing it with anyone including parties claiming to be Saldopedia representatives
sub3.noShare: Not providing account access to third parties. If you suspect unauthorized access to your account, immediately change your password and contact the support team
sub3.report: Immediately reporting to Saldopedia via WhatsApp or official email if suspicious activity, unrecognized transactions, or other security breach indications occur

sub1.title: 4.1 Balance System
sub1.intro: Saldopedia uses an internal balance system that is central to all transaction activities on the platform. Understanding how this system works is essential for an optimal transaction experience:
sub1.step1: Deposit: To start transacting, you need to deposit first. The deposit process is done by transferring funds from your bank account to the official Saldopedia account for the desired amount. After the transfer is confirmed by admin (5-15 minutes), the balance will be added to your account
sub1.step2: Order/Purchase: When you place a BUY order for cryptocurrency, PayPal, or Skrill, the system will deduct your balance according to the total order value. Ensure you have sufficient balance before creating an order
sub1.step3: Sale: When you SELL cryptocurrency, PayPal, or Skrill, the sale proceeds will be added to your account balance after the transaction is confirmed
sub1.step4: Withdrawal: You can withdraw your balance at any time to the bank account registered in your account. The withdrawal process requires verification and will be processed within 5-15 minutes during operating hours
sub1.step5: Balance Transfer: The transfer feature allows you to send balance to fellow Saldopedia users with a minimum transfer of Rp 10,000
sub1.step6: Balance cannot be transferred to other platforms or converted to currencies other than IDR except through available order processes
sub1.step7: Unused balance will remain stored in your account indefinitely as long as the account remains active and does not violate service terms

sub2.title: 4.2 Transaction Limits and Terms
sub2.minValue: Rp 25,000 per transaction. Deposits below the minimum limit cannot be processed and will be returned with administrative fee deduction.
sub2.maxValue: Rp 50,000 per transaction. Withdrawals can be made to all Indonesian banks with 5-15 minute processing time.
sub2.note: Minimum Order: Rp 25,000 for all service types (Crypto, PayPal, Skrill). Maximum transaction varies depending on service and liquidity availability. Limits may change at any time according to platform policy.

sub3.title: 4.3 Deposit Process and Payment Methods
sub3.content: Deposits are made by transferring funds to the official Saldopedia account displayed on the deposit page. We accept transfers from all Indonesian banks (BCA, Mandiri, BNI, BRI, and others). After transfer, you are required to upload proof of transfer through the dashboard. Admin will verify and confirm the deposit within 5-15 minutes during operating hours. Ensure the transfer amount matches the deposit request to expedite verification. Deposits with different amounts will be processed according to the amount actually received.

sub4.title: 4.4 Rates, Spread, and Fees
sub4.realtime: Cryptocurrency rates follow global market prices (CoinGecko) in real-time. Saldopedia applies competitive spreads between buy and sell prices
sub4.inclusive: For cryptocurrency, network fees (blockchain network charges) are displayed separately and transparently when you create a BUY order. This fee is the actual fee charged by the blockchain network
sub4.noHidden: No hidden fees. All fees are clearly displayed before you confirm a transaction
sub4.variable: Rates may fluctuate following market movements. The applicable rate is the rate when the order is confirmed by the system
sub4.applies: For PayPal and Skrill, we apply a tier rate system based on transaction volume. The larger the transaction, the more competitive rate you get

sub5.title: 4.5 Order Processing and Timing
sub5.content: After an order is created and balance is deducted from your account, our team will process the order within 5-15 minutes. For cryptocurrency BUY orders, assets will be sent to the wallet address you provided. For SELL orders, IDR balance will be added to your account after we receive the assets you sent. Order status can be monitored in real-time through the Order History page on the dashboard. If an order takes more than 30 minutes without status update, please contact customer service via WhatsApp with the order number.

section5.title: 5. Cancellation, Refund, and Dispute Resolution Policy

sub1.title: 5.1 Order Cancellation
sub1.content: Orders that have been created and used balance essentially cannot be cancelled because the system processes transactions automatically. However, for orders still in PENDING status and not yet processed, you can contact customer service to request cancellation. If cancellation is approved, the balance will be returned to your account. Orders already in PROCESSING or COMPLETED status cannot be cancelled.

sub2.title: 5.2 Refund Conditions
sub2.intro: Refunds may be considered under the following conditions:
sub2.conditions: that causes balance to be deducted but the order is not recorded or cannot be processed. In this case, the balance will be fully returned after investigation is complete.
sub2.systemError: Deposit with different amount from request. The difference will be adjusted to the amount actually received
sub2.overpay: Order that cannot be fulfilled due to liquidity constraints or operational reasons from Saldopedia. Balance will be fully returned
sub2.notReceived: Cryptocurrency not received at destination wallet within 24 hours due to Saldopedia's error (not due to incorrect wallet address from user)
sub2.refund: Refund process will be made to your Saldopedia account balance. You can then make a withdrawal to your bank account.

sub3.title: 5.3 User Errors and Liability Limitations
sub3.intro: Saldopedia is not responsible for losses caused by user errors. The following are examples of errors that are entirely the user's responsibility:
sub3.wrongAddress: Entering incorrect, invalid, or mismatched cryptocurrency wallet address with the selected network. Transactions to wrong addresses cannot be cancelled or returned
sub3.wrongAmount: Making a deposit with different amount than requested without prior confirmation
sub3.wrongBank: Deposit transfer to account that is not an official Saldopedia account
sub3.lostAccess: Losing access to cryptocurrency wallet, PayPal account, Skrill account, or Saldopedia account due to negligence in maintaining account security

section6.title: 6. Risks, Disclaimer, and Limitation of Liability

sub1.title: 6.1 Cryptocurrency-Related Risks
sub1.content: You fully understand and accept that cryptocurrency and digital assets are highly volatile instruments with high risk. Cryptocurrency values can experience significant fluctuations in a short time, including the possibility of losing all value. Saldopedia does not provide investment advice, financial recommendations, or profit guarantees. The decision to conduct cryptocurrency transactions is entirely your decision and responsibility. Saldopedia is not responsible for losses arising from market value changes, investment decisions, or other external factors beyond the platform's control.

sub2.title: 6.2 Platform Liability Limitations
sub2.intro: Saldopedia is not responsible for direct or indirect losses arising from:
sub2.downtime: Platform service disruption due to scheduled maintenance, system updates, or technical repairs necessary to maintain service quality
sub2.internet: Internet connection problems, user devices, or network infrastructure beyond Saldopedia's control
sub2.blockchain: Transaction confirmation delays on blockchain networks, network congestion, or technical issues on cryptocurrency networks
sub2.delay: Processing delays caused by third parties including banks, payment gateways, or blockchain service providers
sub2.footer: Under any circumstances, Saldopedia's maximum liability is limited to the value of the disputed transaction or the balance stored in the user's account, whichever is less.

sub3.title: 6.3 Force Majeure
sub3.content: Saldopedia is not responsible for failure or delay in fulfilling obligations caused by circumstances reasonably beyond our control, including but not limited to: natural disasters (earthquakes, floods, tsunamis), war or armed conflict, government actions or sudden regulatory changes, pandemics or disease outbreaks, cyber attacks that cannot be prevented with reasonable security efforts, global technology infrastructure failures, or disruptions to major blockchain networks.

sub1.title: 7.1 Saldopedia Rights
sub1.intro: To maintain platform security and comply with applicable regulations, Saldopedia reserves the right to:
sub1.verify: Request additional identity verification (KYC/AML) for transactions of certain amounts, unusual transaction patterns, or when required by regulations
sub1.reject: Reject, cancel, or freeze transactions suspected of violating service terms, applicable law, or potentially harming the platform and other users
sub1.report: Report suspicious activities or transactions indicated to violate the law to law enforcement or competent regulatory authorities
sub1.close: Temporarily suspend or permanently terminate service access for users proven to violate these Terms and Conditions or applicable law

sub2.title: 7.2 Prohibited Activities
sub2.intro: Users are strictly prohibited from using the Saldopedia platform for the following activities:
sub2.fraud: Fraud, identity forgery, phishing, social engineering, or other deceptive activities intended to harm others
sub2.laundering: Money laundering, terrorism financing, or activities that violate money laundering laws
sub2.manipulation: Market manipulation, wash trading, front-running, or unethical trading practices that may affect market integrity
sub2.spam: Sending spam, abusing communication systems, or attempts to disrupt platform operations
sub2.ip: Intellectual property rights violations including trademarks, copyrights, or other proprietary rights of Saldopedia or third parties
sub2.illegal: Other illegal activities under Indonesian law, international law, or the user's jurisdiction of residence

sub1.title: 8.1 Types of Data Collected
sub1.intro: In operating services, Saldopedia collects and processes various types of user data for operational, security, and regulatory compliance purposes:
sub1.transaction: Identity and account data: full name, email address, phone number, verification information, and login credentials
sub1.wallet: Transaction data: order history, deposits, withdrawals, balance transfers, cryptocurrency wallet addresses, and other transaction details
sub1.payment: Financial data: bank account information, proof of transfer, and payment history
sub1.contact: Technical data: IP address, device information, browser fingerprint, and activity logs for security purposes

sub2.title: 8.2 Purpose of Data Use
sub2.intro: Collected data is used for legitimate and necessary purposes, including:
sub2.process: Processing, verifying, and completing transactions you conduct on the platform
sub2.prevent: Detecting, preventing, and investigating fraud, money laundering, and other security violations
sub2.law: Complying with legal obligations, regulations, and legitimate requests from competent authorities

section9.title: 9. Intellectual Property Rights
section9.content: All content on the Saldopedia platform including but not limited to the name "Saldopedia", logo, website design, text, graphics, images, icons, software, database, and other materials are protected by copyright, trademarks, and other intellectual property rights under Indonesian law and international conventions. Users are strictly prohibited from copying, reproducing, distributing, modifying, creating derivative works, publicly displaying, or using such materials for commercial purposes without written permission from Saldopedia. Violation of this provision may result in civil and/or criminal legal action.

section10.title: 10. Terms Changes and Updates
section10.p1: Saldopedia reserves the right to change, update, or revise these Terms and Conditions at any time according to operational needs, regulatory changes, or other considerations. Changes will be announced through the website and/or email notification to registered users. Changes take effect from the publication date or date specified in the announcement.
section10.p2: Use of Saldopedia services after the effective date of changes constitutes your agreement to the updated Terms and Conditions. If you do not agree to the changes, you have the right to discontinue use of services and withdraw remaining balance in your account.

section11.title: 11. Service Suspension and Termination
section11.intro: Saldopedia reserves the right to temporarily suspend or terminate user access to services under the following conditions:
section11.violate: User is proven or strongly suspected to violate these Terms and Conditions
section11.false: User provides false, inaccurate, or misleading information during registration or transactions
section11.suspect: There are indications of fraudulent activity, money laundering, or other illegal activities related to the user's account
section11.authority: Request or order from law enforcement, regulators, or competent courts

section12.title: 12. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution
section12.content: These Terms and Conditions are made, governed, and interpreted under the laws of the Republic of Indonesia. Any disputes arising from or relating to these Terms and Conditions or use of Saldopedia services will be resolved through deliberation to reach consensus. If deliberation does not reach agreement within 30 (thirty) calendar days, the parties agree to resolve disputes through the Indonesian National Arbitration Board (BANI) or competent district courts in Indonesia according to applicable procedures.

section13.title: 13. Contact Information and Customer Service
section13.intro: The Saldopedia team is committed to providing the best customer service. If you have questions, complaints, or need assistance regarding our services, please contact us through the following official channels:
section13.hoursValue: 09:00 - 21:00 WIB every day. Order services and automated systems available 24/7.

section14.title: 14. General and Closing Provisions
section14.content: These Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between you and Saldopedia regarding service use and supersede all prior agreements, understandings, or communications whether written or oral. If any provision in this document is declared invalid, void, or unenforceable by a court or competent authority, such provision shall be severed and shall not affect the validity of other provisions which remain in full force. Saldopedia's failure to enforce any right or provision in this agreement at a particular time does not constitute a waiver of that right and does not preclude future enforcement. Saldopedia may assign its rights and obligations under these Terms and Conditions to another party without your consent, provided that your rights under this agreement shall not be diminished.

commitment.title: Our Commitment to Privacy
commitment.content: Saldopedia is fully committed to protecting the privacy and security of your personal data. As a digital financial services platform that processes cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill transactions, we understand that your personal information and transaction data are highly sensitive. We handle your information with full responsibility, transparency, and in accordance with applicable data protection standards in Indonesia and international best practices. This Privacy Policy is designed to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of our data practices.

privacyPolicy.footer: By using Saldopedia services, you agree to the data collection and usage practices described in this Privacy Policy. If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy practices, please contact our support team.

section1.title: 1. Introduction and Scope
section1.termsLink: This policy is part of our
section1.p1: This Privacy Policy comprehensively and thoroughly explains how Saldopedia collects, uses, stores, processes, shares, and protects your personal information when you access and use our platform for cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill transactions. Saldopedia operates an internal balance system that facilitates fund deposits, purchase and sale order processing, receipt of transaction proceeds, transfers between users, and fund withdrawals. Given the sensitive nature of the digital financial services we provide, proper, secure, and transparent data management is essential to protect your interests and transaction security.
section1.p2: By accessing the Saldopedia website, registering an account, using the user dashboard, communicating with customer service, or utilizing our services in any form, you explicitly consent to the collection and use of personal information in accordance with the terms outlined in this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to any or all terms of this policy, please immediately discontinue use of our services and contact our support team for account closure if needed. This policy applies to all Saldopedia platform users without exception, including registered users, website visitors, and parties who interact with us through official communication channels.
section1.p3: Saldopedia operates under the jurisdiction of the Republic of Indonesia and complies with all applicable laws and regulations regarding personal data protection, including but not limited to Law Number 27 of 2022 concerning Personal Data Protection (PDP Law) and regulations related to digital financial services. We also adopt international best practices in data protection to ensure optimal security standards for all our users.

section2.title: 2. Types of Information We Collect
section2.intro: To provide secure and efficient cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill trading services, Saldopedia collects various types of information from users. We only collect data necessary for service operations, legal compliance, and user experience improvement. The following are the complete categories of information we collect:

sub1.title: 2.1 Identity and Contact Information You Provide Directly
sub1.intro: When you register an account, conduct transactions, or communicate with us, you voluntarily provide the following information:
sub1.contactDesc: Full name as per official identity document (ID/Passport), used for account verification and matching with bank account for withdrawal purposes. Name cannot be changed after registration for security and fraud prevention reasons.
sub1.emailDesc: Active email used for login, account verification, transaction notifications, password reset, and other important communications related to our services.
sub1.phoneDesc: Active phone number used for OTP verification, order notifications, transaction confirmations, and communication with customer service.
sub1.paymentDesc: Cryptocurrency wallet addresses for various networks (Bitcoin, Ethereum, BNB Chain, Polygon, Solana, TRON, etc.), PayPal account email address, Skrill account email address, and Indonesian bank account information (bank name, account number, account holder name) used for deposits and withdrawals.
sub1.transactionDesc: Complete transaction history including balance deposits, buy and sell orders, transfers between users, withdrawals, transaction amounts in IDR and cryptocurrency, applicable rates, transaction status, timestamps, and notes you add to transactions.
sub1.communicationDesc: All messages, questions, complaints, and communications you send via WhatsApp, support email, website contact forms, or other official communication channels, including attachments and media sent.
sub1.newsletterDesc: Email address and preferences if you subscribe to our newsletter to receive promo information, rate updates, crypto tips, and the latest information about our services.
sub1.referralDesc: Your referral code, the referral code you used during registration, history of points earned, and history of point redemptions into balance.

sub2.title: 2.2 Information Automatically Collected by Our System
sub2.intro: When you access and use the Saldopedia platform, our system automatically collects the following technical information for security, analysis, and service improvement:
sub2.deviceDesc: Device type (desktop, mobile, tablet), device brand and model, operating system and version, browser type and version, screen resolution, device language settings, timezone, and other regional settings.
sub2.usageDesc: Pages you visit on our website, navigation sequence, access time for each page, visit duration, features used, buttons clicked, forms filled, searches performed, and interaction patterns with the user dashboard.
sub2.ipDesc: Your public IP address used for account security, suspicious activity detection, fraud prevention, geographic analysis, and regulatory compliance. IP data also helps us identify and block access from unauthorized or suspicious locations.
sub2.cookieDesc: Essential cookies for website functions, preference cookies to save your settings (language, display theme), analytics cookies to understand usage patterns, and pixels or similar technologies to measure content effectiveness. Complete details are available in our Cookie Policy.
sub2.sessionDesc: Cryptographically secure session tokens to keep you logged in, login and logout timestamps, session activity history, and encrypted authentication information.
sub2.logDesc: Records of successful and failed logins, account setting changes, password changes, transaction activity, and other security events for audit trail and investigation purposes if needed.

sub3.title: 2.3 Information Obtained from Third-Party Sources
sub3.intro: In some situations, we receive or access information from trusted third-party sources to complement our data and enhance service security:
sub3.provider: Payment Service Providers: Payment status information, transfer confirmations, and transaction data from cryptocurrency payment gateways such as NOWPayments, as well as verification information from PayPal and Skrill services.
sub3.blockchain: Public Blockchain Data: Transaction information recorded on public blockchains including wallet addresses, transaction hashes, transfer amounts, block confirmations, and transaction timestamps for order verification and tracking.
sub3.social: Social Authentication Platforms: If you choose to login using Google OAuth, we receive basic profile information such as name, email address, and profile photo that you allow to be shared.
sub3.kyc: Identity Verification Services: If additional KYC verification is required, we may receive verification results from third-party identity service providers including name matching, document validity, and risk scores.
sub3.analytics: Analytics Services: Aggregate and anonymous data from third-party analytics services that help us understand usage trends and improve the platform.

sub4.title: 2.4 Sensitive Information and Special Protections
sub4.content: Saldopedia does not intentionally collect sensitive information such as biometric data, health information, sexual orientation, political affiliation, or religious beliefs. We also do not collect personal data from children under 18 years of age. If you believe we have inadvertently collected such information, please contact us immediately for data deletion.

section3.title: 3. Purposes for Using Your Personal Information
section3.intro: Saldopedia uses collected information for various legitimate and necessary purposes in providing secure, efficient, and quality digital financial services. Each use of data is based on legitimate interests and proportional to service needs:

sub1.title: 3.1 Financial Transaction Processing and Management
sub1.intro: As the core of our services, your information is used to facilitate all transaction activities:
sub1.process: Process balance deposit requests by verifying transfer evidence and crediting balance to your account accurately and promptly according to the amount received
sub1.order: Process purchase (BUY) orders for cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill by deducting balance, verifying destination addresses, calculating applicable rates and fees, and sending assets to your wallet or account
sub1.sell: Process sale (SELL) orders by verifying receipt of assets from you, calculating value in IDR, and crediting sale proceeds to your account balance
sub1.withdraw: Process withdrawal requests by verifying bank account name matches with account name, deducting balance, and transferring funds to your bank account
sub1.transfer: Facilitate balance transfers between Saldopedia users with recipient account verification and secure processing
sub1.notify: Send real-time transaction status notifications through dashboard and email, including deposit confirmations, order status updates, cryptocurrency receipt confirmations, and withdrawal confirmations
sub1.support: Provide responsive customer support to resolve transaction issues, answer questions, assist with account recovery, and handle complaints professionally
sub1.manage: Manage and display real-time account balance, store complete transaction history accessible through dashboard, and allow you to download transaction reports

sub2.title: 3.2 Platform Security and Fraud Prevention
sub2.intro: Security protection is our top priority in managing a digital financial platform:
sub2.detect: Detect, prevent, and investigate fraud, money laundering, or service abuse through suspicious transaction pattern analysis, real-time monitoring, and anomaly detection systems
sub2.verify: Verify user identity in accordance with Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) regulations applicable in Indonesia, including name matching verification with identity documents
sub2.access: Implement strict access controls to ensure only you can access your account and conduct transactions, including two-factor authentication and email verification
sub2.monitor: Monitor account activity in real-time to detect suspicious logins, unusual transactions, or account breach indicators, and take necessary preventive actions
sub2.protect: Protect the rights, property, data, and safety of Saldopedia, our users, and the general public from harmful or illegal activities
sub2.block: Block or restrict access from IP addresses, devices, or accounts identified as sources of harmful activity or Terms of Service violations

sub3.title: 3.3 Legal and Regulatory Compliance
sub3.intro: As a digital financial services provider, we have legal obligations that must be fulfilled:
sub3.comply: Comply with all applicable laws and regulations in Indonesia including the Personal Data Protection Law, digital financial services regulations, tax regulations, and anti-money laundering regulations
sub3.report: Maintain transaction records and prepare reports required by supervisory authorities, financial regulators, or tax authorities in accordance with applicable provisions
sub3.respond: Respond to legitimate information requests from law enforcement, courts, or authorized government authorities in accordance with applicable legal procedures
sub3.audit: Facilitate internal and external audits to ensure compliance with applicable security, privacy, and operational standards

sub4.title: 3.4 Service Improvement and Development
sub4.intro: We continuously strive to improve service quality based on data and insights we collect:
sub4.analyze: Analyze website and dashboard usage patterns to identify areas needing improvement, most-used features, and barriers in user experience
sub4.develop: Develop new features, add support for new cryptocurrencies, and enhance platform functionality based on user needs and feedback
sub4.optimize: Optimize website performance, speed up loading times, improve responsiveness, and ensure platform stability under various traffic conditions
sub4.research: Conduct market research and analysis to understand cryptocurrency trends, user preferences, and service improvement opportunities
sub4.test: Test new features, design changes, and functionality improvements through A/B testing or limited testing before general release
sub4.measure: Measure service effectiveness, response times, customer satisfaction levels, and other performance metrics for continuous evaluation

sub5.title: 3.5 Communication and Customer Service
sub5.intro: Your contact information is used to communicate about important service-related matters:
sub5.service: Send important service notifications including policy changes, Terms and Conditions updates, scheduled maintenance, and security announcements requiring your attention
sub5.transaction: Send confirmations and status updates for every transaction you conduct, including deposits, orders, transfers, and withdrawals
sub5.rate: Provide information about rate changes, special promotions, limited offers, and opportunities that may interest you (if you subscribe to newsletter)
sub5.survey: Send customer satisfaction surveys, feedback requests, and invitations to participate in product development
sub5.respond: Respond to questions, complaints, suggestions, and assistance requests you send through our official communication channels quickly and professionally
sub5.education: Provide educational content about cryptocurrency, security tips, and information to help you use our services better

section4.title: 4. Legal Basis for Personal Data Processing
section4.intro: Saldopedia processes your personal data based on one or more legitimate legal grounds as provided in applicable data protection regulations. The following is a complete explanation of the legal bases we use for each type of data processing:

sub1.title: 4.1 Your Explicit Consent
sub1.content: When you register an account with Saldopedia and agree to these Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy, you provide explicit consent for the collection and processing of your personal data. This consent covers the use of data for purposes described in this policy. For marketing activities such as newsletters and promotions, we request separate consent that you can withdraw at any time. Your consent is voluntary, and withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of processing conducted prior to withdrawal.

sub2.title: 4.2 Contract Performance and Service Provision
sub2.content: Processing of your personal data is necessary to fulfill the service contract between you and Saldopedia. This includes processing deposits, buy and sell orders for cryptocurrency, PayPal, and Skrill, fund withdrawals, and all activities related to operating your account. Without this data processing, we cannot provide the services you request. This legal basis also covers pre-contractual steps such as account registration and initial identity verification.

sub3.title: 4.3 Compliance with Legal Obligations
sub3.content: As a digital financial services provider in Indonesia, Saldopedia is subject to various legal obligations that require processing of certain personal data. This includes obligations under the Personal Data Protection Law, anti-money laundering (AML) regulations, Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements, tax authority reporting obligations, and obligations to respond to legitimate requests from law enforcement. Processing based on this legal ground does not require your consent as it is mandated by law.

sub4.title: 4.4 Legitimate Interest
sub4.content: In certain situations, we process your personal data based on our legitimate interests or those of third parties, considering that your fundamental interests or rights do not override those interests. Examples of legitimate interests include: fraud prevention and service abuse, platform security enhancement, service development and improvement, usage analysis for optimization, and protection of our legal rights. We always conduct a balancing test to ensure this processing does not harm your rights.

sub5.title: 4.5 Vital Interests Protection
sub5.content: In rare emergency circumstances, we may process personal data to protect your vital interests or those of others, for example, to prevent significant financial loss due to account breach or fraudulent activity threatening your financial safety.

section5.title: 5. Sharing, Disclosure, and Transfer of Personal Information
section5.intro: Saldopedia greatly respects your privacy and is committed to not selling, renting, or trading your personal information to third parties for their own marketing purposes. However, in certain situations necessary to provide services or fulfill legal obligations, we may share or disclose your information to the following parties with adequate protection:

sub1.title: 5.1 Trusted Service Providers and Business Partners
sub1.intro: We work with selected and trusted third-party service providers to support our platform operations. Each service provider is bound by strict confidentiality and data processing agreements, and can only access data necessary for their tasks:
sub1.payment: Cryptocurrency Payment Service Providers: We partner with NOWPayments and other cryptocurrency payment gateways to process your cryptocurrency transactions. Shared data includes wallet addresses, transaction amounts, and information necessary to verify and complete transactions.
sub1.cloud: Infrastructure and Hosting Services: We use secure and reliable cloud hosting services to store data and run our platform. These hosting providers have internationally recognized security certifications and comply with strict data protection standards.
sub1.email: Email Communication Services: We use Brevo (formerly Sendinblue) to send transactional emails such as account verification, transaction confirmations, and other important notifications. This provider only receives your email address and name for email delivery purposes.
sub1.customer: Customer Communication Platform: We use WhatsApp Business to provide responsive customer service. Communication via WhatsApp includes transaction assistance, order confirmations, and technical support.
sub1.analytics: Analytics Services: We may use analytics services to understand website usage patterns and improve user experience. Analytics data is generally aggregate and anonymous.
sub1.footer: All third-party service providers sign Data Processing Agreements (DPA) governing their obligations to protect your data, limit use only to specified purposes, and ensure adequate security standards.

sub2.title: 5.2 Disclosure for Legal Compliance and Protection
sub2.intro: We may disclose your personal information if required or permitted by law, or if we believe in good faith that such disclosure is necessary to:
sub2.court: Respond to court orders, subpoenas, official information requests from government authorities, or other valid and binding legal processes
sub2.law: Cooperate with law enforcement authorities, Police, Prosecutors, or official investigation agencies in criminal investigations or suspected illegal activities
sub2.aml: Comply with obligations under Anti-Money Laundering (AML) regulations, Counter-Terrorism Financing (CTF), and other financial regulations applicable in Indonesia
sub2.tax: Fulfill reporting obligations to tax authorities or financial regulators in accordance with applicable regulations
sub2.protect: Protect the rights, safety, property, and legitimate interests of Saldopedia, our users, or the general public from threats, fraud, or other harmful activities
sub2.emergency: Respond to emergencies threatening someone's safety or financial welfare

sub3.title: 5.3 Business Transactions and Corporate Restructuring
sub3.content: If Saldopedia is involved in a merger, acquisition, consolidation, asset sale, reorganization, bankruptcy, or similar business transaction, user personal information may be transferred or disclosed as part of that transaction. In such situations, we will take reasonable steps to ensure the receiving party complies with privacy standards equal to or higher than those described in this Privacy Policy. We will notify you via email or website notice before your information becomes subject to a materially different privacy policy, giving you the opportunity to object or close your account if desired.

sub4.title: 5.4 Public Data on Blockchain Networks
sub4.content: It is important for you to understand that cryptocurrency transactions are permanently recorded on public blockchains that are open and transparent. This means cryptocurrency wallet addresses, transaction hashes, transfer amounts, and transaction timestamps can be viewed by anyone with access to blockchain explorers. Saldopedia has no control over the visibility of this blockchain data and is not responsible for disclosure of information that is an inherent characteristic of blockchain technology. We advise you to understand the privacy implications of cryptocurrency use before conducting transactions.

sub5.title: 5.5 Disclosure with Your Consent
sub5.content: In addition to the situations described above, we may share your personal information with third parties if you have given explicit consent for such disclosure. We will always inform you of the purpose and recipient of data before requesting your consent, and you have the right to refuse or withdraw consent at any time.

section6.title: 6. Comprehensive Data Security Measures
section6.intro: As a platform handling digital financial transactions, Saldopedia implements comprehensive layered security measures to protect your personal data and transactions. We continuously evaluate, update, and improve our security infrastructure to address evolving cyber threats.

sub1.title: 6.1 Infrastructure and Network Security
sub1.intro: Our technical infrastructure is equipped with enterprise-level security protections:
sub1.encryptionDesc: All data transmitted between your browser and our servers is protected with SSL/TLS 256-bit encryption, the highest encryption standard used by global financial institutions. This ensures your data cannot be read by unauthorized parties during transmission.
sub1.storageDesc: Sensitive data such as passwords are encrypted using the bcrypt algorithm with unique salt before being stored in the database. Financial data and other sensitive information are also encrypted using industry standards.
sub1.firewallDesc: Our infrastructure is protected with advanced firewalls that filter malicious traffic and Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) that monitor suspicious activity in real-time.
sub1.ddosDesc: Our platform is protected from Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks that could disrupt service availability.
sub1.backupDesc: Your data is backed up regularly to secure and geographically separate locations. We have a disaster recovery plan to ensure service continuity in emergency situations.

sub2.title: 6.2 Access and Authentication Security
sub2.intro: We implement strict access controls to protect your account and data:
sub2.accessDesc: Access to user personal data is strictly limited only to authorized personnel who require such access to perform their duties. Every access is logged for audit purposes.
sub2.sessionDesc: Session tokens are cryptographically generated and have limited validity periods. Sessions will automatically expire after periods of inactivity to prevent unauthorized access.
sub2.passwordDesc: Passwords must meet minimum complexity requirements and are hashed using bcrypt before storage. We never store passwords in plain text.
sub2.verificationDesc: Email verification is required for account registration, and OTP verification via WhatsApp is available for sensitive operations such as point redemption.

sub3.title: 6.3 Monitoring and Threat Detection
sub3.intro: Our security systems actively monitor and detect potential threats:
sub3.monitoringDesc: Our security systems are monitored in real-time around the clock to detect suspicious activity, breach attempts, or anomalies requiring investigation.
sub3.loggingDesc: All important activities are recorded in immutable logs for audit, incident investigation, and regulatory compliance purposes.
sub3.alertDesc: Our system automatically alerts the security team when suspicious activity is detected or normal thresholds are exceeded.

sub4.title: 6.4 Incident and Data Breach Handling
sub4.p1: Although we implement the best available security measures, we understand that no system is 100% immune to cyber attacks. If a data breach affecting your personal information occurs, we will take the following steps in accordance with our legal obligations and transparency commitment:
sub4.p2: We will immediately investigate the incident to determine its scope and impact, take action to stop the breach and prevent further damage, notify you directly via email within a reasonable time after the breach is identified, report the incident to the competent data protection authority in accordance with applicable law, and provide information about steps you can take to protect yourself.
sub4.p3: We also advise you to maintain the security of your account credentials by not sharing your password with anyone, using a strong and unique password, contacting us immediately if you suspect unauthorized access to your account, and regularly checking your account activity and transaction history.

section7.title: 7. Data Retention and Storage Policy
section7.intro: Saldopedia retains your personal data only as long as necessary to fulfill collection purposes, provide the services you request, and comply with applicable legal obligations. We implement a clear data retention policy to ensure data is not stored longer than necessary.

sub1.title: 7.1 General Data Storage Principles
sub1.content: Your personal data is stored as long as necessary to provide services, fulfill contractual obligations, and comply with legal and regulatory requirements. Retention periods are determined based on data type, processing purpose, legitimate business needs, and applicable legal obligations. We periodically review the data we store and delete data that is no longer needed in accordance with our retention policy.

sub2.title: 7.2 Retention Periods by Data Type
sub2.intro: The following are the retention periods applicable to various types of data we collect:
sub2.transactionDesc: Complete transaction history including deposits, orders, transfers, and withdrawals is retained for a minimum of 10 (ten) years in accordance with Indonesian tax regulations and anti-money laundering regulations. This data includes amounts, dates, parties involved, and transaction evidence.
sub2.accountDesc: Basic account information such as name, email, phone number, and bank account information is retained while your account is active and up to 5 (five) years after account closure for audit, dispute resolution, and regulatory compliance purposes.
sub2.communicationDesc: Customer service communication history via WhatsApp, email, and other channels is retained for 3 (three) years for problem resolution, service quality audit, and documentation purposes.
sub2.securityDesc: Access log data, logins, account activity, and security events are retained for 2 (two) years for security, incident investigation, and audit purposes.
sub2.marketingDesc: Newsletter preferences and marketing information are retained while you subscribe and deleted within 30 days after you unsubscribe or request deletion.
sub2.legalDesc: Certain data may be retained longer than standard periods if required by law, regulations, or for ongoing or anticipated litigation purposes.

sub3.title: 7.3 Data Deletion and Anonymization Procedures
sub3.content: After retention periods expire or when data is no longer needed for legitimate purposes, your data will be securely deleted using irreversible deletion methods, or anonymized in such a way that it can no longer be linked to your identity. Anonymized data is no longer considered personal data and may be used for statistical analysis, research, and service improvement without time limits. Deletion is conducted systematically and documented to ensure compliance.

sub4.title: 7.4 Retention Period Exceptions
sub4.content: In certain situations, we may retain data longer than standard periods if necessary to fulfill legal obligations, respond to requests from government authorities, enforce our Terms and Conditions, resolve disputes, protect our legal rights, or if you provide consent for longer storage.

section8.title: 8. Your Rights as a Data Subject
section8.intro: In accordance with Indonesia's Personal Data Protection Law and international data protection principles, you have a number of rights regarding your personal data that we process. Saldopedia is committed to respecting and facilitating the exercise of these rights. The following is a complete explanation of your rights:

sub1.title: 8.1 Right to Access Information
sub1.content: You have the right to know whether we process your personal data and to request access to a copy of that data. Upon your request, we will provide information about: the types of personal data we hold about you, the purposes for processing that data, the parties to whom data may have been disclosed, applicable retention periods, and the source of data if not collected directly from you. We will provide this information in a clear and readable format within 30 (thirty) business days from when the request is received.

sub2.title: 8.2 Right to Correct and Update Data
sub2.content: You have the right to request correction of inaccurate, incomplete, or outdated personal data. You can update some account information directly through the settings page in your user dashboard, including email address, phone number, and bank account information. For changes that cannot be made independently such as name corrections, please contact our support team with valid identity evidence. We are committed to processing correction requests within a reasonable time.

sub3.title: 8.3 Right to Delete Data (Right to be Forgotten)
sub3.content: You have the right to request deletion of your personal data in certain situations, including: when data is no longer needed for the original collection purpose, when you withdraw consent and there is no other legal basis for processing, or when data has been unlawfully processed. However, this right to deletion is not absolute and may be refused if processing is necessary to fulfill legal obligations (such as tax or anti-money laundering regulations), to enforce or defend legal claims, for archival or research purposes, or to resolve ongoing transactions or disputes.

sub4.title: 8.4 Right to Restrict Processing
sub4.content: You have the right to request restriction of processing of your personal data in the following situations: when you question data accuracy and we are verifying it, when processing is unlawful but you prefer restriction over deletion, when we no longer need the data but you need it for legal claims, or when you have objected and we are considering it. During the restriction period, we will continue to store the data but will not process it for other purposes without your consent.

sub5.title: 8.5 Right to Data Portability
sub5.content: You have the right to receive personal data you have provided to us in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format (such as CSV or JSON). You also have the right to request that we transmit that data directly to another service provider where technically feasible. This right applies to data processed based on consent or contract performance and that is processed automatically. To exercise this right, please contact our support team.

sub6.title: 8.6 Right to Object to Processing
sub6.content: You have the right to object to processing of your personal data in certain situations, including: processing for direct marketing purposes (including profiling for marketing), and processing based on our legitimate interests. If you object to processing for direct marketing, we will immediately cease such processing. For objections based on legitimate interests, we will assess whether our legitimate interests outweigh your rights.

sub7.title: 8.7 Right to Withdraw Consent
sub7.content: If processing of your personal data is based on consent, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time. Withdrawal of consent does not affect the lawfulness of processing conducted prior to withdrawal based on that consent. To withdraw newsletter consent, you can use the unsubscribe link in each email. For other consent withdrawals, please contact our support team.

sub8.title: 8.8 Right to Lodge a Complaint
sub8.content: If you believe that processing of your personal data violates your rights or applicable data protection regulations, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent data protection authority in Indonesia. However, we strongly encourage you to contact us first so we have the opportunity to address your concerns directly.

sub9.title: 8.9 How to Exercise Your Rights
sub9.intro: To exercise any of the above rights, you can contact us through the following official channels:
sub9.process: After receiving your request, we will verify your identity to ensure data security. Verification may require additional information such as confirmation of your registered email address or answers to security questions. We will respond to your request within 30 (thirty) business days from successful identity verification. If your request is complex or we receive many requests, this period may be extended with notice to you.
sub9.footer: We do not charge fees for exercising these rights, unless requests are repetitive, excessive, or unfounded, in which case we may charge a reasonable administrative fee or refuse the request.

section9.title: 9. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
section9.intro: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience. For complete information, please read our

sub1.title: 9.1 Types of Cookies Used
sub1.necessaryDesc: Required for basic website functions such as security and navigation.
sub1.preferenceDesc: Store your choices such as language and display theme.
sub1.analyticsDesc: Help us understand how visitors interact with the website.
sub1.marketingDesc: Used to display relevant ads based on your interests.

sub2.title: 9.2 Managing Cookies
sub2.content: You can manage cookie preferences through the cookie banner on the website or your browser settings. Disabling certain cookies may affect website functionality.

section10.title: 10. Children's Privacy
section10.content: Saldopedia services are not intended for children under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If you become aware that a child has provided personal data to us, please contact us for data deletion.

section11.title: 11. International Data Transfers
section11.p1: Your data may be transferred to and stored on servers located outside Indonesia for processing and storage purposes.
section11.p2: We ensure that international data transfers are conducted in accordance with adequate data protection standards through contractual agreements with service providers.
section11.p3: By using our services, you consent to data transfers outside Indonesian territory for the purposes described in this policy.

section12.title: 12. Third-Party Website Links
section12.p1: Our website may contain links to third-party sites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of those sites.
section12.p2: We recommend that you read the privacy policy of each site you visit. This privacy policy only applies to information collected by Saldopedia.

section13.title: 13. Privacy Policy Changes
section13.p1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal obligations.
section13.p2: Significant changes will be announced through website notifications or email. The "Last updated" date at the top indicates when this policy was last revised.
section13.p3: Continued use of our services after changes means you accept the updated policy. If you do not agree with the changes, please discontinue use of our services.

section14.title: 14. Contact Us
section14.intro: If you have questions, comments, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us through:
